abstract: Lee June-seok, captain of South Korean ferry that capsized in 2014 killing over 300 people, receives life sentence on charges of murder for abandoning ship without attempting to help passengers.
lead_paragraph: Lee Jun-seok was convicted of murder through willful negligence by a South Korean judge for his role in the sinking of the Sewol last April.

headline.main: Life Term for Captain in South Korea Ferry Disaster
headline.print_headline: Life Term for Captain in Ferry Disaster

snippet: Lee Jun-seok was convicted of murder through willful negligence by a South Korean judge for his role in the sinking of the Sewol last April.
